intro: Tilia bohemica, commonly known as the Bohemian linden, is a deciduous tree native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Tiliaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and fragrant, yellowish-white flowers. The tree produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain smooth, light brown seeds. It typically grows to a height of 15–25 meters and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. The bark is smooth and grayish-brown, becoming fissured with age.
